2699	rkr	Oct 10, 2015	Yes	Better option	Micromax has kept skinning to an absolute minimum. The experience is essentially stock Android 5.0 Lollipop and it certainly helps with performance.Connectivity options on the Micromax Canvas Spark are bog standard. You get the usual 3G HSPA+, WiFi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.0 and GPS. The phone has Dual SIM support with 3G support on slot 1 and the second slot being relegated to 2G speeds. This is common for entry-level devices and not something we can really complain about. Of the 8GB of storage, there is about 3.6GB of free space available. You can bump that up via the microSD card slot. We tried out a 64GB card in the handset and it worked just fine despite the company‚Äôs claim of supporting up to 32GB of extra storage. The phone supports USB OTG as well and you can easily swap the default write disk between phone storage, SD card and the external USB storage.

4277	sameer chavan	Sep 20, 2015	Yes	Budget phone with some issues	I brought this on Snapdeal. They did not allow anyone to put reviews for subsequent sales too. So new buyers has no idea on the experience of the first buyers. Here some of the issues  1. There is NO move to SD card option. So all the apps are downloaded in phone memory. It has some 3gb available for users. But if you download games, it will eat up the memory. 2. There is NO option to reduce notification volume separately.  Both ringer and notification volume are connected and change at the same time.  3. There is NO option to set wallpaper for lock screen separately then home screen.  4. The so claimed gorilla glass is fake plastic acrylic. You can feel the touch when you tap the screen, it goes a bit inside like a plastic layer.  5. The screen is not touch responsive. You have to tap couple of times to invoke an app.  6. The software update is a custom micromax app that is provided by a spam Chinese company. It reads your activity and pushes apps download automatically. Even if you uninstall the preloaded apps, it will download it in background again  7. The phone is full of malware, adware and spyware, bundled by micromax.  I finally rooted the phone using kingroot and deleted all these malware. I had to also delete the software updater as it was constantly pushing ads. I know i will not be able to update this phone. But who updates micromax phones.  Now the phone is working good.

5424	sonu	Sep 04, 2015	Yes	best  phone ever	Performance and camera brilliant  We won't mince any words - we faced a lot of performance issues with the Canvas Spark. There were times when an app wouldn't open for a good 15 seconds after we had touched its icon. Also, sometimes the screen wouldn't be responsive after waking the device from standby. Thankfully, these issues didn't completely break the experience but the phone definitely did not feel smooth enough. High-end games struggled with constant stutters, but casual games worked fine. We must highlight the fact that all the Android One phones use the same SoC, but provide a better experience.  In the AnTuTu and Quadrant benchmark tests the phone scored 19,499 and 5,494 points respectively, which are in line with what we achieved with other phones with similar hardware. The Canvas Spark also scored 9.3fps and 3,231 in the GFXbench and 3DMark Ice Storm graphics tests.

6988	iqbal C M-cochin	Jul 22, 2015	Yes	Awesome phone in this price range-Micromax Canvas Spark Q380 8GB ROM-	Pros: Touch is great, nice looks, very fast and no lags, headphone provided is great, very nice display, clear and crisp,Battery backup is excellent Cons: speaker not too loud, installed apps are not of great use, quite heavy (personal opinion)  Micromax has equipped the Canvas Spark smartphone with a quad-core MT6582M chipset, running at clock speed of 1.3GHz, backed by 1GB of RAM. The handset comes with 8GB of internal storage and has microSD card support up to 32GB capacity.  The rear camera has 8MP resolution and is backed by LED flash, whereas the front camera has a 2MP sensor. The connectivity features are pretty standard: 2G, 3G, Wi-Fi, microUSB 2.0 and Bluetooth. The smartphone packs a 2,000mAh battery; it is 8.5mm thick and weighs 134grams, making it pretty compact despite the 4.7-inch screen. Overall: I am happy with the device and I think it is a great smartphone and people should really buy it rather than buying a high end smartphone like Samsung or some others which offer similar features for high prices. If you are on minimal budget 5k then go for this. If you are concerned about the brand and status then no one can stop you from opting for other brands.

7761	QuantumDude	Jul 05, 2015	Yes	Great phone! Some flaws...	The phone is great for it's price! It's a nice phone with a big screen and good processor speed, there are no lags, amazingly responsive touch and nice display! And nice and convenient to carry around.        As for looks, it looks really premium. I recommend using white, if you're going for looks, white has an amazingly sleek matted finish at it's back. Black might look a bit dull but black phones always can go through more wear and tear. But if you buy a white, I recommend getting a cover to protect it's back if you don't want to spoil it.      But there are some features that are not satisfying, like the camera, it's not so good; and the resolution is not great either; also, it has 8GB internal memory, but only has 3-4GB free. Then the battery life, it's not very good. The speaker is not very loud... you have to switch on vibration too.       But don't go in it's flaws! You might not even find these flaws if you're not searching for them!       Overall, AMAZING and THRILLING phone for it's price! I recommend buying this phone other than any other expensive phone!

11685	Umesh Goyal	Jun 19, 2015	Yes	Perfect. It doesn't get any better	Design is the one of the biggest positives of Micromax Canvas Spark. The brightness levels are pretty high, so it is pretty easy to read text and view images without missing out on details even under direct sunlight. Additionally, the screen is protected by Gorilla Glass 3 to protect it against scratches. The smartphone packs a 2,000mAh battery; it is 8.5mm thick and weighs 134grams, making it pretty compact despite the 4.7-inch screen. Micromax Canvas Spark is among the few smartphones to come with Android 5.0 (Lollipop).  One cant expect higher for a pocket friendly price than Lollipop, quad-core processor and 1 GB of RAM. Battery life of Canvas Spark, on the other hand, is pretty good. Another highlight is the network connectivity this phone offers. Micromax Canvas Spark is a decent smartphone for the price. The build, battery and network connectivity are counted in its strong suit. There are many small disadvantages of camera clarity but it deifnately makes a good buy for the small budget latest android phone.

In Micromax you cannot make memory card to default write disk even there is a option in lollipop for this. There were no lags at all and asphalt 8 ran smoothly.  4: Sharp display: Display of the phone is nice to look at. It is vibrant and sharp. 1080p videos play well. Watching movies and playing games is what this phone is made for.  You get good qulaity earphones with the phone. Speaker of the phone it loud and clear.   And the cons  1: Battery is on a bit lower side. Although you get almost a day's juice  2. Display could have been a bit better with HD resolution but for this less price, its not bad.  3. Quality of usb cable and earphones cable is not so good. They don't seem much durable.  Cons are minor as compared to pros. This phone is worth every penny you spend. Don't give it a second thought just go for it.

By Amar from, delhi HOW TO WRITE CUSTOMER-FRIENDLY REVIEWS? Product centricity: Concentrate only on product feedback and DO NOT include service or seller feedback. Reviews with such content will NOT BE made live Simple language: Keep the language simple, light and in your own words Be crisp: If the details run long, break the review into readable short paragraphs and bullets No profanity: Profanity, copyrighted comments or any copied content must be avoided Share your experience: Explain what you liked and disliked about the product. The most helpful reviews are the ones that help readers know exactly what to expect Pros & cons: Select or add appropriate pros & cons to give a quick summary of your review to the reader Best usage: Mention best uses of the product and why should one buy it SNAPDEAL REVIEW MODERATION Please note that all the submitted reviews are moderated and it may take 3-5 business days for it to appear on the site. 14606	Ganesh	Jun 09, 2015	Yes	Canvas Spark is the best feature-rich phone at this price.	Being a kind of "techie" person, when I saw all these great features at this price, I tried to acquire as much as possible tech info and reviews about this phone before placing the order. Then I got the phone delivered on 29th may and then used it continuously and observed all tech features very closely, then writing this review. I thought, use the product at least for 10-12 days, before writing anything pros or cons.  Pros.  Nicely Designed, Built Quality is also good, touch works Smoothly, GPS lock the positioning within a minute and camera is just fine if you take photos in sufficient light and keep your hand steady. Oh yes..! one thing I didn't know before, that it can record Super HD video at 1920x1088 pixel too, which is very rare. Many high budget phones doesn't have this feature. I don't play games but during doing multitask I didn't notice any hang or lags till now. I read, many negative comments about the battery. So here I would like to say, it may varies device to device and usage. Piece I got, it gives me 2 days battery backup without using internet. If i use internet with no downloads  (Browsing sites, checking emails 9-10 times a day) then it gives one & half day battery backup and I think its normal for android.  Cons. Photo taken in low light has much noise. Internet download speed is slow, on device and even on PC. When use as modem.  Still I say you can't find any other phone at this price, with all these features: 4.7" display, Gorrila glass, 8mp rear & 2mp front camera, Super HD 1920x1088 video recording etc. So just grab this Mobile, and feel proud on our Indian Product.

It pushes notification about random apps to be installed. Cannot be disabled.  5. Apps cannot be transferred to SD.  6. Available inbuilt storage around 4 gb 7. Susceptible to lags.  Overall an OK phone. If you can increase your budget a bit, you should go for better options.

(note : i am not heavy phone user i.e. i am normal phone user i.e. i don't play games etc but i use phone for watsapp/fb/music/calls etc a lot.) *Only thing which i don't like about phone is "NOT removeable battery" ..battery is fixed with phone.So in case if mobile hangs so i guess i need to wait for battery to drain out (i am checking for alternative options on internet) ..Did not hangout as of now.  Overall: I think this is best phone in 5k range.

Pros: Touch is great, nice looks, very fast and no lags, headphone provided is great, very nice display, clear and crisp Cons: Battery backup is poor, speaker not too loud, installed apps are not of great use, quite heavy (personal opinion) Overall: I am happy with the device and I think it is a great smartphone and people should really buy it rather than buying a high end smartphone like Samsung or some others which offer similar features for high prices. If you are on minimal budget 10k - 15k then go for this. If you are concerned about the brand and status then no one can stop you from opting for other brands.

18544	gaurav mandotia	May 28, 2015	Yes	Yes, Finnaly I Got the one I need .....	Canvas Spark houses a trendy design. The top edge of the tablet has got a 3.5 mm audio jack and a micro usb 2.0 port is located on the lower edge of the phone. The screen lock button and the volume buttons lie on the right edge. It incorporates a 1.3 GHz quad-core processor with 1 GB of RAM. The inbuilt memory is of 8 GB which can be expanded up to 32 GB by a micro SD card. The powerhouse of the device is a 2000 mAh battery.  Operating System and Software Features  Canvas Spark runs on Android OS v5.0 (Lollipop) platform. The rivals of Canvas Spark, like Motorola Moto E 2nd gen, Lenovo A6000 are really worth comparing. The phone includes Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, 3G, GPS and dual sim support.   Camera and Display  Canvas Spark sports an 8 MP auto focus primary camera and has an LED flash to accompany the elite lens. Daylight pictures are crisp and work very well on finer details. The 8 MP camera can capture 720p videos. The 2 MP front camera fulfils the purpose well enough and is really appreciable.  The 5 inch display of the phone has a resolution of 960x540 pixels and a capacitive touchscreen. The display possesses a pixel density of 234ppi and features Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protection as well.  Overview  You can buy Micromax Canvas Spark online at the e-commerce store like Snapdeal. The processing speeds are good, and multitasking experience is a fine experience too. The device overall is one of the appreciable options in its price range.

It has occured five times till now while m typing this review. Its very irritating. If u are fond of playing games then this is nod the right device for you. You will feel some lag after a racing game session of abt 20 mints. Pre installed apps r good. Touch works very nice. Battery lasts maximum for a day without using multimedia n much net. Overall nice phone at this price.

19724	Vicky	May 24, 2015	Yes	Worth a buy	The delivery was quick. Likes:The phone is good. It has 240 ppi display density. The touch is smooth. Doesn't lag. Many of bloatwares can be uninstalled. Supports only micro sim cards. Wifi works as a charm. No connection breaks. Supports WPS push button, WPS pin entry, wifi direct and built-in screen casting (wireless display). Running foreground apps are shown on lock screen. Lock screen also suggests the time remaining for full battery charge. The rear camera is good in results and so is the front one. Rear camera is auto focus type whereas front camera is fixed focused. Pictures are grainy sometimes. The flash is effective in low lights scenes. Dislikes: The battery is non-removable Li-Polymer type which surely works better in respect of standby but screen time isn't that great. The speaker volume inaudible if you're in the crowd. The media playback volume isn't good either. The speaker lack a little woofing/bass. The earphones provided are in-ear type but the output is pathetic. The sound output is seems to be hitting the head. Nowhere close to Samsung but that's incomparable keeping in mind the price gap between MMX and Samsung. Worth a buy if you mostly use silent profile (like I prefer) or you have a Bluetooth headset. Been around 10 days but no heating problem noticed so far.

19920	Prince	May 23, 2015	Yes	Cheapest handset today to run Android 5.0 Lollipop	The Micromax Canvas Spark is in many ways a very interesting device. For one, it is the cheapest handset today to run Android 5.0 Lollipop straight out-of-the-box. Secondly, it is also the cheapest handset today to come with a Corning Gorilla Glass 3 protective cover on the front.The Canvas Spark is an ultra-budget smartphone, therefore obviously it has limitations.  That said we could have lived with some of these limitations, but as things stand today we have choices, and clearly better ones. You may argue, there are not many good handsets at Rs.4,999 which is right to some extent.  But we cannot totally wrap our minds around the Spark because of its inconsistent nature and heating woes. If you're a first timer looking to enter the world of Android, this one should make more sense for you especially since you're getting Lollipop out-of-the-box.

21235	gujju nagakumar	May 20, 2015	Yes	BEST PHONE EVER	hey guyz . I bought this phone before 1 month. the phone is working perfect . 1.8m Back Camera is very good. . Front is ok great. the best thing about the camera is auto focus. Camera is heavily customised.  2.display is good. however viewing angles are too great but satisfactory. display is bright enough . you cant feel any problem even in sunlight. 3.sim card are working good,network strenght is also good.but one thing that i felt is bad we can not connect manually to 3G network .  Performance of the cpu is quite impressive. Antutu benchmark is best score which is realy surprising in this range. heads off to .3GHz Quad Core Cortex A7 Processor. 4.speaker Sound is very clear however too low . we can not hear anything in noisy environment . sound in headphone is very impressive . however u cant get any of the earphone within the box . you have to sort out some extra bucks for this. 5.The design of the phone is very good. good thing is capactive buttons are out of screen but bad thing is they are not BACKLED.back cover is good ,it has rubberised coating . feels very good in hand .power button and volume rockers are made of cheap plastic with metal finishing. 6.Gorrila glass looks good . it would get any of scratches hardly. 8. Call quality is pretty awesome and crystal clear. 9. Battery : one of the major problem with the phone is its battery. battery is of 2000 mAH which is not too bad . normally phone works for 6 to 7 hour in continuous usage of wifi and web browsing. but guyz today em gonna tell you how u can increase the battery life . first location services and auto syncing should be off. second smart saving function should be on in ultra saving mode . third u cant find in the phone . but i m telling how you do find in the phone . Go to setting>About>software information >build number. click on build number 5 times continously . now it will tell you that now you are a Developer. now open setting again and u will find the option of "developer option" at bottom side . open it and find "set background process" at bottom side ,open and "set it two or one." now done . it will increase your battery life from 4 hours to 8 hours. battery would not drain automatically even in stand by mode . Thank you all.

22131	Raj the technical expert.	May 18, 2015	Yes	Really good phone and awesome stuff in this range.	I bought the phone at the 6th may sale and got it on 11th. When i opened the box,i found that there is no battery in the box,then i noticed that it has a non removable battery. The mobile has a sleek and classy look.It looks like that you have some very expensive mobile.The mobile has all the features as shown in the specs.But has some cons and pros. PROS: 1.)Really good camera,back camera and front camera both are absolutely fine. Didn't expected that level from Micromax. 2.)The display is mind blowing, looks like HD screen,even when it is a qHD screen. 3.)Gorilla Glass 3 gives extreme protection to your phone, you won't have to use screen gaurd. Using a screen gaurd will bring more scratches than as usual. 4.)Android LOLLIPOP is awesome in looks and is also fine working. 5.)Internal storage is good in this range and also a good RAM of 1GB. runs all the apps needed. 6.)Touch is super sensitive and screen is like butter. Your fingers will slide over the screen. CONS: 1.)Overheating issues of mobile,the phone gets over heated after doing a little hard work.The area around the camera becomes so hot that your fingers can burn. 2.)The internal is quite good but it gives a headache that you can't transfer the files to SD card. Only 5 GB of space is given 3GB is already taken by mobileOS.Your internal will be filled easily,so install only those apps that you need. 3.)The phone has 1GB ram but even then it has some lagging issues(only sometimes) but that is not likely to be a con. 4.)The back panel of the mobile is classy but attracts a lot of finger prints and dust. So i recommend to buy the black model, white will get dirty very easily.  Over all the phone is a good selection at this price rate, you will not get GORILLA GLASS 3 at this price rate,8 + 2 MP camera  and quad core and the "BHAROSA" of  MICROMAX.

After using this smartphone I would say, if your budget is fixed at 5500 or 5000 then guys this is the best smartphone for you. To summarize everything let me gave my views on it's Pros & Cons. Cons: 1- Camera doesn't seems at par, nothing like an 8MP camera & focus lock is really slow sometimes. 2- UI is slow even with 1GB RAM & Stock android, advance user can easily feel it.  Overall: I would not recommend this device to advance users, who have already used a good Android device but for new users, this device is like a must buy. 24817	Shruthi	May 14, 2015	Yes	Perfect!	I was on the lookout for a budget smartphone to be given as a gift. I couldn't have asked for anything better than the Canvas Spark, a very affordable power-packed smartphone that delivers a punch.  Pros: Android 5.0 Lollipop, amazing processing speed, no lags, clear display, Corning Gorilla Glass protection Cons: The phone comes with a number of pre-installed apps, most of which are not of use and which cannot be installed. These apps consume more than half of the internal 8 GB storage. Battery backup is average. Also, the battery is not removable, so you cannot pop in a spare battery on the go. Overall: The cons are few and can be easily overlooked for a smartphone of this price range. I absolutely loved the device. This is probably the best budget smartphone available today.

25158	gopal	May 12, 2015	Yes	Pocket-Friendly Smartphone	Micromax has used the tried-and-tested MediaTek MT6582 SoC on the Canvas Spark. This SoC uses four 1.3GHz processor cores and integrated Mali 400 graphics. The phone also has 1GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage space. Storage can be expanded by up to 32GB using a microSD card.  The primary camera on the Canvas Spark can capture 8-megapixel still images and shoot 720p video, and there is a 2-megapixel camera on the front. The phone accepts two Micro-SIM cards, of which at least one can connect to a 3G network. Rounding off the other connectivity options are Wi-Fi a/b/g/n and Bluetooth v4.0. A 2000mAh battery powers the device, giving it a rated talk time of 7 hours and rated standby time of 335 hours.

25895	Sidd	May 08, 2015	Yes	Just like my Galaxy S3!	I bought the phone as a backup option, as my 2.5yrs old S3 had started giving some signs of being on the verge of dying.  The phone is absolutely perfect, with great 8MP back shooter and 2MP front shooter with image qualities almost at par with my S3.  The front glass does attracts some fingerprints, but then a screen guard is provided with it.  The resolution, though might seem low on paper, but in reality, it seems quite crisp.  The back cover looks really sturdy, though the white one might attract some dust over time, especially given that no good cases are available for the device yet.  The pre-installed apps are many, but some of them (almost half of them) are removable. The ones from Micromax are non user removable. But, one can always root the phone and remove those useless apps.  The Android Lollipop, out of the box runs awesome on the phone. Though, I'm aware that further updates might not be rolled for the device anytime soon or in future.  The only things I could have asked for more were a better speaker, a better notification light, and a better set of earphones (yes, even at this price range!)
